intro: Achneria brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its blooming period occurs during the rainy season, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
